31  class PumpkinPlanner {
32  ros::ServiceServer _server;
33  ros::NodeHandle _nh, _snh;
34  ros::CallbackQueue _serverQueue;

36  robot_model::RobotModelPtr _model;

38  //planning_interface::PlannerManagerPtr _planner;

49  PumpkinPlanner() {
50  //Loads the robot model
51  robot_model_loader::RobotModelLoader pumpkinModelLoader("robot_description");
52  _model = pumpkinModelLoader.getModel();
53 
54  //Create the planning scene
55  _planningScene.reset(new planning_scene::PlanningScene(_model));
56  //std::string plannerName;
57 
58  //Sets the planner pipeline, and deactivate the messages published by it, to make the system simple.
59  _plannerPipeline.reset(new planning_pipeline::PlanningPipeline(_model, _nh, "planning_plugin", "request_adapters"));
60  _plannerPipeline->displayComputedMotionPlans(false);
61  _plannerPipeline->checkSolutionPaths(false);
62  _plannerPipeline->publishReceivedRequests(false);
63 
64  ROS_INFO("Model and scene loaded.");
65  /*
66  * Below here was the version using the PlannerManager, but the Pipeline is more complete (and ease to use)
67  boost::scoped_ptr<pluginlib::ClassLoader<planning_interface::PlannerManager> > plannerLoader;
68 
69  if (!_nh.getParam("planning_plugin", plannerName))
70  ROS_FATAL_STREAM("Could not find planner plugin name");
71  try
72  {
73  plannerLoader.reset(new pluginlib::ClassLoader<planning_interface::PlannerManager>("moveit_core", "planning_interface::PlannerManager"));
74  }
75  catch(pluginlib::PluginlibException& ex)
76  {
77  ROS_FATAL_STREAM("Exception while creating planning plugin loader " << ex.what());
78  }
79  try
80  {
81  _planner.reset(plannerLoader->createUnmanagedInstance(plannerName));
82  if (!_planner->initialize(_model, _nh.getNamespace()))
83  ROS_FATAL_STREAM("Could not initialize planner instance");
84  ROS_INFO_STREAM("Using planning interface '" << _planner->getDescription() << "'");
85  }
86  catch(pluginlib::PluginlibException& ex)
87  {
88  const std::vector<std::string> &classes = plannerLoader->getDeclaredClasses();
89  std::stringstream ss;
90  for (std::size_t i = 0 ; i < classes.size() ; ++i)
91  ss << classes[i] << " ";
92  ROS_ERROR_STREAM("Exception while loading planner '" << plannerName << "': " << ex.what() << std::endl
93  << "Available plugins: " << ss.str());
94  }
95  */
96 
97  //Set the callback to the service.
98  //This works.
99  _snh.setCallbackQueue(&_serverQueue);
100 
101  _server = _snh.advertiseService("/pumpkin/planner", &PumpkinPlanner::plan, this);
102  ROS_INFO("Planner initialized.");
103  }
104 
108  ~PumpkinPlanner() {
109  _server.shutdown();
110  }

143 
144  bool PumpkinPlanner::plan(pmsg::PlannerRequest &req, pmsg::PlannerResponse &res) {
145 
146  ROS_INFO("Calling planner");
147 
148  planning_interface::MotionPlanRequest planReq;
149  planning_interface::MotionPlanResponse planRes;
150  moveit_msgs::RobotTrajectory resMsg;
151 
152  //now is a robot state related to the planning scene. So, modifing this state will modify the robot in the scene.
153  robot_state::RobotState &now = _planningScene->getCurrentStateNonConst();
154 
155  //That after is the final robot state, that will be used to build the goal constraints.
156  robot_state::RobotState after(_model);
157  int i = 0;
158  //For each group...
159  for (auto it = _joint_groups.begin(); it != _joint_groups.end(); ++it) {
160  //planReq.goal_constraints.clear();
161  //These vectors will handle the joints positions, in the order they're seen in the robot model
162  //(and also the robot state)
163  std::vector<double> joint_now, joint_after;
164  //Fill the first vector with the positions (so we have the positions... ok)
165  (*it)->getVariableDefaultPositions(joint_now);
166  /* Uncomment this to see the positions. (LOOK FOR THE SIZE OF THE VECTOR TOO)
167  for (auto it2 = joint_now.begin(); it2 != joint_now.end(); ++it2)
168  std::cout << *it2 << ' ';
169  std::cout << std::endl;
170  */
171 
172  //Copy the joint_after with the joint_now positions
173  //This will ensure that both joints are in the same positions for now
174  joint_after = joint_now;
175  /*
176  * Change the positions that we have an Arduino PIN associated
177  * It means that joint positions that we receive from the "playback_action"
178  * We will leave the joints that we don't receive, so (in theory) the joints that are not read
179  * will be still the same
180  */
181  for (int j = 0; j != joint_now.size(); ++j) {
182  int index = _indexes[i++];
183  if (index == -1)
184  continue;
185  joint_now[j] = req.initial_positions[index];
186  joint_after[j] = req.final_positions[index];
187  }
188  /* Uncomment this to see the final positions
189  for (auto it2 = joint_after.begin(); it2 != joint_after.end(); ++it2)
190  std::cout << *it2 << ' ';
191  std::cout << std::endl;
192  */
193 
194  /* Uncomment this to see the joint limits. Use it to check bounds calibration.
195  for (auto it2 = (*it)->getActiveJointModelsBounds().begin();
196  it2 != (*it)->getActiveJointModelsBounds().end(); ++it2) {
197  if ((*it2)->at(0).position_bounded_)
198  std::cout << "Min position: " << (*it2)->at(0).min_position_ << ", max position: " <<
199  (*it2)->at(0).max_position_ << std::endl;
200  else
201  std::cout << "Joint not bounded" << std::endl;
202  }
203  */
204 
205  //Set the robot states
206  now.setJointGroupPositions(*it, joint_now);
207  after.setJointGroupPositions(*it, joint_after);
208  }
209 
210  //I put that the planner HAVE TO plan in less than 1s.
211  planReq.allowed_planning_time = 1.0;
212  //Uncomment this to scale the robot speed. For now, we are not using the speed get from the planner, so it' useless.
213  //planReq.max_velocity_scaling_factor = 0.1;
214 
215  /*
216  * Now, for the planning. In a strange way. The planner only plans each joint group per time.
217  */
218  for (auto it = _joint_groups.begin(); it != _joint_groups.end(); ++it) {
219  //Sets the requirement
220  planReq.group_name = (*it)->getName();
221  planReq.goal_constraints.clear(); //Clear this for not repeat constraints
222 
223  //Set the constraints with a helper function, just use the final robot position and the joint group
224  planReq.goal_constraints.push_back(kinematic_constraints::constructGoalConstraints(after, *it));
225 
226  //Solve
227  _plannerPipeline->generatePlan(_planningScene, planReq, planRes);
228  //If not solved, print some info.
229  if (planRes.error_code_.val != planRes.error_code_.SUCCESS) {
230  ROS_ERROR("Could not get the planned trajectory. Error: %d", planRes.error_code_.val);
231  return false;
232  } else {
233  ROS_INFO("Planned ok.");
234  }
235 
236  //Set the robot state to the last planning position (as an intermediate state)
237  _planningScene->setCurrentState(planRes.trajectory_->getLastWayPoint());
238  //planRes.getMessage(resMsg);
239  //ROS_INFO("Planned %d positions.", (int) planRes.trajectory_->getWayPointCount()); //<-- get the number os positions
240 
241  //Push the planned trajectory to the robot
242  planRes.trajectory_->getRobotTrajectoryMsg(resMsg);
243  res.joint_trajectory.emplace_back(resMsg.joint_trajectory);
244  }
245  ROS_INFO("Planning complete.");
246  return true;
247  }
248 
249  bool PumpkinPlanner::setJoints(const std::string &group_name, const std::map<std::string, int> &joints) {
250  //We have a brand new joint model group, yeah!
251  _joint_groups.push_back(_model->getJointModelGroup(group_name));
252  bool success = false;
253  /*
254  * Now, pay atention here!!!
255  * We have to get in wich order the joints are disposed in the group, so we can make the indexes translation
256  * If, for instance, the first joint that we get from the group is associated with the PIN 3 in Arduino
257  * so, we should put the number 3 in the first index of the vector.
258  * But, if we don't have a PIN related to the joint. Let us put -1, so we know that we will skip that joint later.
259  * CHECK THIS AFTER, IF YOU FACE PROBLEMS LATER:
260  * There are two functions that give the joints in each positions. But one of them give from the very base joint
261  * to the final joint of the group. And another just the joints that are variable. I used that second... it should
262  * work IF the joints are simple. From the time that we have a composite joint (I really don't know, but i read that
263  * not ever each variable is associated with each joint), we face problems.
264  */
265  const std::vector<std::string> &ordered_names = _joint_groups.back()->getVariableNames();
266  for (std::vector<std::string>::const_iterator it = ordered_names.begin(); it != ordered_names.end(); ++it) {
267  auto it2 = joints.find(*it);
268  if (it2 == joints.end()) {
269  ROS_WARN("Coud not find %s for %s part", it->c_str(), group_name.c_str());
270  _indexes.push_back(-1);
271  } else {
272  ROS_WARN("Inserted joint %s at position %d", it->c_str(), it2->second);
273  _indexes.push_back(it2->second);
274  success = true;
275  }
276  }
277  return success;
278  }
279 
280 }
281 
290 int main(int argc, char *argv[]) {
291  //Start ROS
292  ros::init(argc, argv, "pumpkin_planner");
293  ros::start();
294 
295  //Wait for the config to be loaded
296  ros::Rate loop(1000);
297  while (!ros::param::has("pumpkin/config")) {
298  loop.sleep();
299  }
300 
301  //Now we create the planner and all that stuff.
302  pumpkin::PumpkinPlanner planner;
303 
304  //We load the pumpkin calib config
305  XmlRpc::XmlRpcValue config;
306  ros::param::get("/pumpkin/config/arduino", config);
307 
308  //And now we set the joints
309  //I use a map to identify the joint name and the pin
310  for (auto it = config.begin(); it != config.end(); ++it) {
311  std::map<std::string, int> joint_names;
312  for (auto it2 = it->second.begin(); it2 != it->second.end(); ++it2) {
313  if (it2->second["analog_read_max"] == it2->second["analog_read_min"])
314  continue;
315  char side = it->first[0];
316  if (side == 'l' || side == 'r') {
317  std::string name = side + ("_" + it2->first);
318  //ROS_WARN("%s", name.c_str());
319  joint_names[name] = int(it2->second["pin"]);
320  }
321  }
322  if (joint_names.size() > 0) if (!planner.setJoints(it->first, joint_names)) {
323  ROS_FATAL_STREAM("Could not set joints in " << it->first);
324  return -1;
325  }
326  }
327 
328  ROS_DEBUG("Joints set");
329 
330  //Main loop. Let it go.
331  while (ros::ok()) {
332  planner.rosCall();
333  ros::spinOnce();
334  }
335 
336  //Bye ROS
337  ros::shutdown();
338 
339  return 0;
340 }
